enter_url_password: Enter the password to generate encrypted url.
passphrase_created:
We have created a passphrase for you in the box below.
This passphrase lets you access your wallet and the funds it contains.
write_your_passphrase: Write your passphrase down and keep it safe.
if_you_lose_passphrase: If you lose this passphrase, you will lose access to your wallet forever.
if_someone_get_passphrase: If someone gets your passphrase, they gain access to your wallet.
we_do_not_store_your_passphrase: We do not store your passphrase and cannot recover it if lost.
i_have_written_passphrase: I have <u>written down</u> or otherwise <u>securely stored</u> my passphrase.
quick_access_intro_1: To avoid having to type the full 12-word passphrase every time you log into Counterwallet, you can optionally use a special Quick Access URL that is produced by entering a password of your choosing.
quick_access_intro_2: If you don't know what this means, just click Skip This Step below.
copy_down_secret_url: Copy down the following secret URL and use with your password for quick access:
new_to_counterwallet: New to Counterwallet, and want to just play around?
dev_mode_enabled: Dev Mode Enabled
counterwallet_desc_1: Counterwallet is a web-wallet for Counterparty, the world’s first protocol for decentralized financial tools.
counterwallet_desc_2: All transactions made with Counterwallet use an automatic escrow system to keep them secure, with no middleman required.
counterwallet_desc_4: All encryption is handled client-side. Neither your passphrase nor any of your private information ever leaves your browser.
counterwallet_desc_5: Counterwallet passhrases are highly secure, so you know that your wallet is safe from all brute force attacks. They are also easy to learn and hard to mistype.
counterwallet_desc_7: With Counterwallet, your passphrase is your wallet, and all of your addresses and keys are generated on-the-fly when you log in.
counterwallet_desc_8: There are no wallet files to backup or keep private, and with your passphrase you can access your wallet from any trusted machine with a web browser.
counterwallet_desc_10: Counterwallet and Counterwalletd are entirely open-source, so you know that they work exactly the way that they are supposed to.
counterwallet_desc_11: If you like, you may also even run your own Counterwallet server.
is_the_first_time: If you are being asked to accept the Terms and Conditions, this is the first time you are opening this wallet. If you are trying to access an old wallet, you have typed the passphrase incorrectly.
you_must_read: You must read and accept the following agreement in order to use this site:
secure_passphrase_desc: Each text box below corresponds to a word in your 12-word passphrase. To enter your passphrase, click on each box and use the on-screen keyboard that appears, then press the Login button when done. This approach limits the ability that malware and keyloggers have of stealing your passphrase.
choose_your_handle_desc:
To use chat, you must have a handle (or nickname) you wish to use (alphanumeric/underscore/hyphen, between 4 and 12 characters).

Please remember that people in chat may not always be who they seem. Until a verified identity system is implemented for chat, do not simply trust someone is who their handle says they are!
enable_auto_btcpay_desc: If this option is enabled, Counterwallet will automatically take care of making BTC payments for matched orders where you owe BTC. It is highly recommended you keep this on. If not enabled, you must manually settle any required BTC payments within a 10 block limit (approximately 80-100 minutes).
advanced_options_warning:
Don't change followings parameters, unless you know exactly what you are doing.
If you change them, your BTC orders could not match.
These parameters are not persistent.
default_expiration_desc: Blocks until expiration (This is ~6.75 days at ~9 min per block).
default_expiration_btc_desc: Blocks until expiration for selling BTC order.
reset_state_desc: Click this button to reset custom color settings, widget positioning, etc.
show_info_desc: Click to show some useful information for troubleshooting wallet issues.
enter_password_to_crypt: Enter the password to encrypt the passphrase.
click_to_generate_passphrase: Click to generate another random passphrase.
try_the_following: If you are having issues using Counterwallet, please try the following:
support_1: Ask in Counterwallet chat: Click on the Show Chat link on the left menubar, and ask your question there. Someone may know the answer.
support_2: Check out our forums: You can post your question or issue in the Counterparty support forums.
support_3: Open a support ticket: If all else fails, you may open a support ticket.
answers_to_common_questions: Answers to common questions. Just click the one you're interested in:
answer_1: I logged in and my address is different, and I have no balance! Help!
answer_2: I sent funds to a crowdsale vending machine, why didn’t they show up?
answer_3: I sent BTC to Counterwallet, why doesn't it show up?
answer_4: Why do I need small amounts of Bitcoin to do things in Counterwallet?
answer_5: An address I added in Counterwallet is not showing -- why?
answer_9: What does something like “XCP/BTC” mean, in Counterwallet?
answer_11: I placed an order to buy BTC for something else. What I offered was removed from my account, but I don't see the BTC yet!
answer_12: Why does it cost me a little Bitcoin to cancel an order!?
for_other_questions: For other questions, please ask in
donation_desc:
Send a donation to support Counterparty and Counterwallet development.
Counterparty is non-profit, self-funded, open source and community supported. We appreciate any donations, and all donations go directly towards supporting future development.
create_support_case_desc1: Create a support case by filling out the information below.
create_support_case_desc2:
Please only create a case for bugs only.
For questions, check out our knowledge base or ask in our forums.
required_support: Required so that we can provide a response to you.
enter_desc_problem: Enter an in-depth description of your problem
check_to_inclued_screenshot: Check this box to include a screenshot, which helps us better diagnose the issue.
we_get_back_to_you: We will try to get back to you within 24 hours, via email, to the address you have provided.
cant_find_public_key: Can't find the public key for this address. Please make a transaction with it and try again.
address_already_in_wallet: This address is already in your wallet.
address_desc_too_long: Address description is more than 70 characters long.
quantity_exceeds_balance: Quantity entered exceeds your current balance.
cannot_send_server_unavailable: Cannot send BTC right now, as we cannot currently get in touch with the server to get your balance. Please try again later.
not_valid_testnet_pk: Not a valid TESTNET private key
not_able_to_sweep: We're not able to sweep all of the tokens you selected. Please send %s BTC transactions to address %s and try again. OR use the following fields to pay fees with another address
funds_sent_failure: Funds not sent due to failure.
ownership_transfer_failure: Ownership not transferred due to failure.
sweep_from_completed:
The sweep from address %s is complete.
Sweep results:
sending_btc_for_sweeping_fees: Sending %s BTC from %s to pay sweeping fees.
quantity_must_be_between_0_and_1: Quantity entered must be between 0 and 1 BTC.
quantity_of_exceeds_balance: The quantity of %s entered exceeds your available balance.
you_can_only_burn: You can only burn 1 BTC total for any given address. Even over multiple burns, the total quantity must be less than 1 BTC.
you_will_be_burning: You will be burning %s BTC for approximately %s XCP.
you_have_burned: You have burned %s BTC for approximately %s XCP.
not_available_asset_to_send: You have no available %s at address %s to send.
not_available_asset_to_burn: You have no available %s at address %s to burn.
lock_asset_warning:
By locking your token, you will not be able to issue more units of it in the future.

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
no_more_token_may_issued: No more units of the token may be issued.
no_enough_for_issuance_fee:
You need at least %s XCP to create a token, however, your current balance is only %s XCP.

Please deposit more XCP into this address and try again.
asset_length_invalid: Asset name is too long, or too short
token_desc_too_long: Token description is more than %s bytes long.
token_name_rules: Must contain uppercase letters only (A-Z), be at least 4 characters in length, and cannot start with 'A'.
call_date_required: Call date is required if the token is callable
call_price_required: Call price is required if the token is callable
issuance_quantity_too_high: The quantity desired to be issued for this token is too high.
call_date_in_past: Call date cannot be in the past.
token_will_be_created: Your token %s will be created.
token_has_been_created: Your token %s has been created.
issuance_end_message: It will automatically appear under the appropriate address once the network has confirmed it, and your address %s will be deducted by %s XCP.
issuance_exceed_max_quantity: This issuance would exceed the hard limit for maximum quantity.
you_will_be_issuing: You will be issuing %s additional quantity on your token %s.
you_have_issued: You have issued %s additional quantity on your token %s.
asset_will_be_transfered: %s will be transferred to %s.
asset_has_been_transfered: %s has been transferred to %s.
same_description_token: This description is the same as the current description.
desc_will_be_changed: The description for token %s will be changed to %s.
desc_has_been_changed: The description for token %s has been changed to %s.
total_diviend_exceed_balance: The total dividend would exceed the address' balance for the selected Dividend Token.
you_will_paying_dividend: You will be paying a distribution of %s %s per outstanding unit to holders of token %s.
you_have_paid_dividend: You have paid a distribution of %s %s per outstanding unit to holders of token %s.
you_will_calling_back: You will be calling back %s%% of token %s for the price of %s XCP.
you_have_called_back: You have called back %s%% of token %s for the price of %s XCP.
token_not_callable_until: Token %s cannot be called until %s
token_created: Token created with description '%s' and total issuance of %s units. Owned by address %s
additional_issuance_done: An additional <Am>%s</Am> units issued. Total issuance increased to <Am>%s</Am> units
token_transferred_from_to: Token transferred from address <Ad>%s</Ad> to address <Ad>%s</Ad>
op_change_username: %s has changed the chat handle for %s to %s
lost_chat_feed_link: Lost chat feed link and attempted to correct. Please try sending your chat line again.
invalid_handle: Invalid handle, must be between 4 and 12 characters with only alphanumeric, underscore or hyphen allowed.
you_are_choosing_to_donate: You are choosing to send %s %s to support development.
you_chose_to_donate: You chose to send %s %s to support development.
you_sell_order_will_be_placed: Your order to sell %s %s will be placed.
you_sell_order_has_been_placed: Your order to sell %s %s has been placed.
you_buy_order_will_be_placed: Your order to buy %s %s will be placed.
you_buy_order_has_been_placed: Your order to buy %s %s has been placed.
these_fees_are_optional: These fees are optional, go directly miners (not to us) and are non-refundable.
cancel_consume_btc: Requests to cancel an order will still consume BTC (necessary to pay the Bitcoin miner fee). To avoid this, let your order expire naturally.
we_recommend_to_use_xcp: We recommend to use XCP for your next trades! It's faster, cheaper, and you don't have to stay logged in.
no_balance_for_btc_pay: You do not have the required BTC balance to settle this order. Please deposit more BTC into address %s and try again.
confirm_btc_payment: Confirm a payment of %s BTC to address %s to settle order ID %s?
auto_btcpay_done: Automatic BTC payment of %s BTC made from address %s for %s %s.
auto_btcpay_error: There was an error processing an automatic BTC payment. This payment has been placed in a pending state. Please try again manually.
btcpay_required:
A payment on a matched order for %s BTC is required, however, the address that made the order (%s) lacks the balance necessary to do this automatically. This order has been placed in a pending state.

Please deposit the necessary BTC into this address and manually make the payment from the Bitcoin icon in the top bar of the site.
order_match_succesfull:
An order match for %s %s was successfully made. To finalize, this requires payment of %s BTC from address %s.

You must pay within 10 blocks time, or lose the purchase. Pay now?
auto_btcpay_to_be_made: Automatic BTC payment of %s BTC to be made from address %s for %s %s.
auto_btcpay_made: Automatic BTC payment of %s BTC made from address %s for %s %s.
notif_you_received: You received <Am>%s</Am> <As>%s</As> from <Ad>%s</Ad> to your address <Ad>%s</Ad>
notif_order_cancelled: Order/Bid ID %s for your address %s was cancelled
notif_callback_done: <As>XCP</As> balance adjusted on your address(es) <Ad>%s</Ad> due to <Am>%s%%</Am> callback option being exercised for token <As>%s</As>
notif_dividend_done: <As>%s</As> balance adjusted on your address(es) <Ad>%s</Ad> due to <Am>%s</Am> distribution being issued for token <As>%s</As>
notif_token_locked: Token <As>%s</As> was locked against additional issuance
notif_token_desc_changed: Token %s had its description changed from %s to %s
notif_token_issued: Token <As>%s</As> was issued with an initial quantity of <Am>%s</Am> units
notif_order_buy_active: Your order to buy <Am>%s</Am> <As>%s</As> from <Ad>%s</Ad> in exchange for <Am>%s</Am> <As>%s</As> is active
notif_order_expired: Your order ID %s from address %s has expired
notif_self_order_match_expired: An order match between your addresses <Ad>%s</Ad> and <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
notif_order_match_expired: An order match between your address <Ad>%s</Ad> and address <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
notif_feed_locked: You have locked the feed at address <Ad>%s</Ad>
notif_value_broadcasted: You have broadcast value <Am>%s</Am> from address <Ad>%s</Ad>
notif_bet_expired: Your bet ID %s from address %s has expired
notif_self_bet_match_expired: A bet match between your addresses <Ad>%s</Ad> and <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
notif_bet_match_expired: A bet match between your address <Ad>%s</Ad> and address <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
notif_rps_expired: Your RPS game ID %s from address %s has expired
notif_self_rps_match_expired: A RPS match between your addresses <Ad>%s</Ad> and <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
notif_rps_match_expired: A RPS match between your address <Ad>%s</Ad> and address <Ad>%s</Ad> has expired
pend_or_unconf_lock: %s lock of token <As>%s</As> against additional issuance
pend_or_unconf_change_desc: %s change of description for token %s to %s
pend_or_unconf_issuance_add: %s issuance of <Am>%s</Am> additional units for token <As>%s</As>
pend_or_unconf_issuance: %s creation of token <As>%s</As> with initial quantity of <Am>%s</Am> units
hist_rps_match: Rock-Paper-Scissors bet matched between <Ad>%s</Ad> and <Ad>%s</Ad>, wagering <Am>%s</Am> <As>XCP</As>
hist_rpsresolve: Rock-Paper-Scissors bet match %s resolved, source: %s, winning move is %s
no_counterparty_error: No counterparty servers are currently available. Please try again later. ERROR: %s
multi_connection: You appear to be logged into Counterwallet elsewhere. It's not safe to be logged into the same wallet account from multiple devices at the same time. If you are sure that this is not the case, press Continue. Otherwise, please press Cancel, logout from your other device, and try again.
infos_sent_to_support: Thank you, your information has been sent to our support team. You will receive further ticket information in your email.
wager_exceeds_balance: Wager entered exceeds the address balance.
no_enough_xcp: None of your addresses contain enough XCP
rps_please_stay_logged: Please stay logged in so that the game(s) can be properly resolved. Once your game has been matched, it will take one more block for the game to complete. Be careful, if you close the Wallet before the end of the game you can lose money!!
you_will_placing_rps: You will be placing %s XCP on %s.
btc_sync_error: Got an error when trying to sync BTC balances: %s
tx_validation_failed: Client-side transaction validation FAILED. Transaction will be aborted and NOT broadcast. Please contact the Counterparty development team
insufficient_btc:
Cannot do this action as you have insufficient BTC at this address. Due to Bitcoin fees, each Counterparty action requires approximately %s BTC to perform.

Please deposit the necessary BTC into %s and try again.
to_complete_armory_tx: To complete the transaction, please copy over and sign the text below on your offline Armory system, then bring back to Counterwallet to broadcast:
pending_notice: This action will take some time to complete, and will appear as a Pending Action until confirmed on the network. Until that time, the wallet will not reflect the change. Please be patient.
exit_warning: If you log out, any Bitcoin sell orders you have open will probably not be filled.
brower_not_supported_header: Your browser is not supported with Counterwallet
brower_not_supported_text: Counterwallet's security features require a newer browser than what you are using. We recommend Chrome for the best user experience. Also, note that Microsoft Internet Explorer is not supported due to it's lack of full support for Content-Security-Policy restrictions.
network_processing_failed: Network processing of the following action failed
max_number_addresses: You already have the max number of addresses for a single wallet (%s). Please create a new wallet (i.e. different passphrase) for more.
old_wallet_warning: We detected that you have an 'old' wallet with funds present. Press 'OK' to sweep these funds into your new wallet, or Cancel to skip for now.
logout_message: You can improve your security further after logging out by closing this opened browser
forbiden_country: It appears that you are located in a country in which we are legally unable to provide this service.
testnet_proceed_anyway: Since you are on testnet, you can choose to proceeed anyway.
you_are_choosing_to_send_from_to: You are choosing to send %s %s to %s
you_are_chose_to_send_from_to: You are chose to send %s %s to %s
you_have_no_in_wallet: You have no %s in your Wallet
my_account_balances: My Account Balances
sell_btc_pending: Sell BTC Pending: As you have one or more pending or open sell order for BTC, please stay logged in so that the order(s) can be properly filled.
address_actions: Address Actions
name: Name
label: Label
enter_address_description:
Enter the description you'd like to use for this new address.

Please NOTE that once you create a new address, you cannot delete it.
enter_address_description_watch_only: Please enter the info for the address you would like to add into your wallet as a watch-only address.
enter_address_description_armory: Please enter the info for the address you would like to add into your wallet as an Offline Armory address.
signed_transaction_from_armory: Enter the signed transaction from the Offline Armory system.
enter_raw_transaction: Enter the raw transaction to be signed.
broadcast_datetime: The date and time of the broadcast.
broadcast_form:
Use this form to broadcast data.

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
text_note: The textual part of the broadcast (set to ‘LOCK’ to lock feed).
broadcast_note: The numerical value of the broadcast.
fee_fraction_note: the fraction of bets on this feed that go to its operator.
call_price_note: The XCP price per unit that the owner of the token may call it back for.
callable_token_note: Callable tokens may be called back at a specific date for a specific strike price.
divisible_token_note: Divisble assets can be subdivided into decimal places.
is_locked_note: Locked tokens may not have additional unit issued.
call_date_note: The date and time after which the owner of the token may choose to call it back.
call_token_note: Enter the percentage of the token to call back (e.g. 40.5 for 40.5
distribution_unit_note: Enter the quantity of the Distribution Token that should be distributed per share of %s.
distribution_token_note: The token in which the distribution is paid.
pay_holders_note: Pay a distribution to holders of this token.
send_tokens_to_address:
Send %s from your address %s to the address you enter below.

You have %s %s available to send from this address.
import_tokens_wallet: Import (Sweep) Tokens from Your Old Wallet
import_funds_address: Import token funds by "sweeping" them from an external address into an address in this wallet.
import_funds_wallet: Transition to your new wallet by sweeping over the token funds from your old wallet.
enter_unencrypted_private_key: Enter the unencrypted private key to the address with the tokens you want to move over.
from_old_wallet_note: Select the address in your old wallet that the specified tokens should be sent from.
destination_address_note: Select the address in your wallet that the specified tokens for the private key above should be sent to.
tokens_to_sweep_note: Select all of the tokens whose total balances you want to move into the destination address.
private_key_pay_fees: Private Key used to pay fees
private_key_pay_fees_note: Enter the unencrypted private key that cooresponds to the address used to pay fees.
call_price_note: The XCP price per unit that the owner of the token may call it back for.
call_date_note: The date and time after which the owner of the token may choose to call it back.
make_callable_note: Callable token may be called back at a specific date for a specific strike price.
make_divisible_note: Divisble tokens can be subdivided into decimal places. If you are unsure, keep this option checked.
description_note: Optional text that provides more information about the token.
quantity_note: How many of the units of the token to issue (can be increased later).
for_address_note: The address the token will be created on.
private_key_warning: Please make sure nobody can look over your shoulder or see your screen.
old_wallet_detected: Old Wallet detected: We see you are using an old wallet. Please transfer your funds to a newly created wallet as soon as possible. Support for 'old' wallets will be discontinued July 15, 2014.
want_to_buy_xcp: Want to buy XCP? Beyond using the decentralized exchange in Counterwallet, other options for purchasing XCP are
enter_new_label: Enter the new label (or, nickname) for your address %s.
after_sending: After sending, you will have %s %s remaining at this address (minus fees).
message_to_sign_note: Enter the message text to be signed.
xcp_bal_remaining_post_call_one: At the given call price of %s XCP per unit of %s (which has %s units issued and %s units outstanding), your total cost for a %s callback would be %s XCP.
xcp_bal_remaining_post_call_two: After this callback, this address would have a remaining balance of
xcp_bal_remaining_post_call_three: %s XCP, and gain %s %s, for a final balance of %s %s.
use_this_form:
Use this form to exercise a call option for the selected token (%s), any time after its call date of %s.

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
this_distribution_payment: This distribution payment would cost you a total of
after_distribution_payment: After distribution payment this address would have a remaining balance of
pay_holders:
Use this form to pay holders of any token a distribution using XCP or any other token. Note that the full required balance of the token paid out must be present at this same address.

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
address_transfer_ownership:
Enter the Bitcoin address you would like to perminently transfer ownership of this token to. (Be aware that this will not transfer the actual units of this token that you own to this address -- you can do that with a separate Send transaction.)

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
more_token_issue:
How much more of this token would you like to issue? (For divisible tokens, state the quantity as a whole or floating point number, not in satoshis -- e.g. '732.45')

There are currently %s units of this token issued.

Please NOTE that this action is irreversable!
asset_creation_fee_xcp: Please note that a %s XCP fee will be deducted from your balance upon successful creation.
change_token_description_p2: Enter the new description for this token
token_an_image: Want to give your token an image, enahnced description text, or more? See
after_burning: After burning, you will have approximately
create_xcp_testnet: Create XCP on Testnet by "burning" your test BTC. Please note that you can only burn up to 1 BTC total for any given address.
burn_up_to: You may currently burn up to
already_burned: You have already burned the maximum allowed BTC from this address.
welcome_p1: We've created an address for you to get started. You can send and receive both bitcoin and Counterparty tokens with it. To start using the wallet, simply send some BTC or XCP to the address (just single click on the address string itself to select it, then copy that text, which you can then give to others or use to send funds to).
note_testnet: Note that, on testnet, you can use a
btc_to_start: to get BTC to start with
welcome_p2: One important thing to know before getting started is that when you perform an action in Counterwallet (i.e. place an order, create a token, etc), it doesn't take effect immediately as it must first be confirmed on the Bitcoin blockchain. Counterwallet lets you know this by displaying your actions under the Pending Actions panel (the Clock icon on the top bar), and then moving them to the Notifications panel (the Checkbox icon) automatically once the network has successfully confirmed them. You'll also see the future expected value in parenthesis next to the current balance to better alert you that the change is pending. Note that depending on the speed at which blocks are solved, it could take anywhere from 2 to 40 minutes for your actions to be confirmed.
rps_please_stay_logged2:
Pending Game: As you have one or more pending game, please stay logged in so that the game(s) can be properly resolved. Once your game has been matched, it will take one more block for the game to complete.
Be careful, if you close the Wallet before the end of the game you can lose money!!
do_not_wager_on_different_addresses: Do not make multiple wagers of the same size on different addresses in your wallet, as they can match each other.
expiration_rps_desc: how many blocks a counterparty has to take the other side of the game.
cant_find_feed: We can't find a feed at this address
odds_note: how much do you want to win per 1 XCP.
leverage_note: how sensitive bet will be to movements in the value.
deadline_note_binary: when this bet will be decided.
deadline_note_cfd: when this bet will be liquidated.
expiration_note: how many blocks a counterparty has to take the other side of the bet.
for_every_xcp: XCP for every 1 XCP you bet
payment_required_for_matched_order: A payment of %s BTC is required from %s to settle payment for matched order %s.
blocks_left_until_btcpay: %s block(s) (~%s) left until order %s/b> is eligible for % BTC payment.
recent_counterparty_transactions: Recent Counterparty Transactions (last 60 days, exclude BTC transactions)
license:
1. GRANT OF LICENSE

1.1. Subject to the terms and conditions contained within this end user agreement (the “Agreement“), Counterwallet.co grants the “User” (or “you”) a non-exclusive, personal, non-transferable right to use the Services on your personal computer or other device that accesses the Internet, namely Counterwallet.co and/or Counterwallet federated nodes (together, the “Services“). By clicking the “I Agree“ button if and where provided and/or using the Service, you consent to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

1.2.  The Services are not for use by (i) individuals under 18 years of age, (ii) individuals under the legal age of majority in their jurisdiction and (iii) individuals accessing the Services from jurisdictions from which it is illegal to do so. Counterwallet.co and Counterwallet federated nodes are unable to verify the legality of the Services in each jurisdiction and it is the User's responsibility to ensure that their use of the Services is lawful. Counterwallet.co and Counterwallet federated nodes are neither banks nor regulated financial services. Operators do not have access to the Bitcoins stored on the platform, instead Counterwallet.co and Counterwallet federated nodes simply provide a means to access Bitcoins, Counterparty (XCP), and other digital assets recorded on the Bitcoin blockchain. Bitcoin private keys are encrypted using the BIP32 Hierarchical Deterministic Wallet algorithm such that Counterwallet.co and Counterwallet federated nodes cannot access or recover Bitcoins, Counterparty (XCP), or other digital assets in the event of lost or stolen password. 

2. NO WARRANTIES.
